multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the 5 smooth reflexive polytopes among the 16 shown?
choices: They correspond to Calabi-Yau 3-folds with exceptional holonomy.
They represent the 5 Platonic solids in 3-dimensional space.
They correspond to the toric del Pezzo surfaces, which are smooth toric Fano 2-folds.
They are the only reflexive polytopes with a volume smaller than 1.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the notation "dP_n" refer to in this figure?
choices: The n-th del Pezzo surface, formed by blowing up P^2 at n generic points.
The n-th dimensional projective space, P^n.
The n-th Hirzebruch surface, F_n.
The n-th symmetric power of a curve, Sym^n(C).

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure presents two different constructions of Calabi-Yau varieties from a reflexive polytope ∆_n. Which of the constructions is the focus of this article?
choices: The construction of compact (n-1)-dimensional smooth Calabi-Yau hypersurfaces.
The construction of non-compact Calabi-Yau cones over X(∆).
The construction of both compact and non-compact Calabi-Yau varieties.
The construction of K3 surfaces as double covers of del Pezzo surfaces.
The equivalence between smooth toric varieties and their fans.
The construction of a Calabi-Yau hypersurface in a toric variety.
Dual web-diagrams and the corresponding toric diagrams for C^3/Z_3.
The relationship between the Hilbert series and the volume function.
A plot of the Euler number of a Calabi-Yau 3-fold against its volume.
The graph of the Hilbert series for the cone over C^3/Z_3.
The shape of the Sasaki-Einstein 5-manifold base of the cone over C^3/Z_3.
A bi-plot of the volume function for C^3/Z_3 with b_3 = 3.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the orange points in Figure 8 represent?
choices: Toric Calabi-Yau 3-folds with K3 fibrations.
Toric Calabi-Yau 3-folds which are Abelian orbifolds of C^3.
Smooth, compact Calabi-Yau 3-folds.
Toric Calabi-Yau 3-folds with the largest possible volume.

multiple_choice_question.text: What interesting observation can be made from the plots in Figure 13?
choices: The minimum volume of a toric Calabi-Yau always decreases with increasing Euler number.
The product of the minimum volume and the Euler number reaches a maximum value for specific toric Calabi-Yaus.
The Chern number of a toric Calabi-Yau is directly proportional to its volume.
The Euler number of a toric Calabi-Yau is inversely proportional to its volume.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the plots in Figure 17 suggest about the relationship between the Chern number and the volume of reflexive toric Calabi-Yau 4-folds?
choices: There is no clear relationship between the Chern number and the volume.
The Chern number determines a lower bound on the minimum volume.
The Chern number determines an upper bound on the minimum volume.
The minimum volume is always inversely proportional to the Chern number.
